author: kfogel
msg: Start beating on the config code, for issue 579.  Note that there are
still problems remaining.  Note also that although it currently uses
the single-big-config file approach, we're not necessarily committed
to it -- just need to start somewhere to shake out the bugs in file
parsing, which is just as true whether we go for single file or
(svn_config_destroy): Removed; clearing or destroying the enclosing
pool is the way to do this.
(svn_config_read): Just use passed-in pool.  Don't use
APR_HASH_KEY_STRING, use the length we have already.  Don't call
svn_config_destroy.  Add comment explaining the Win32 code.  Format
(find_option): Don't use APR_HASH_KEY_STRING, use the length we have
(parse_section): Don't eat the char after the newline.  No
o.b.o.e. playing allowed!  There's another such bug lurking
somewhere, though, because this change only allows us to parse the
first option name in a section correctly; subsequent options are
still right-shifted by one char.  See "### kff" comment in
SVN_REGISTRY_HKCU_LEN): Use sizeof() instead of hardcoding.
stripped whitespace off the end of the data.
(svn_string_strip_whitespace): Add comment about why we're not
